item.title: Psychoanalysis and the communist movement
item.description:
http://en.internationalism.org/ir/140/the-legacy-of-freud

This is the article on Freud published on the ICC website. As the introduction points out, this is a contribution to debate and not a positional document of the ICC. All considered comments welcome. In this case, it may be useful to say that I am the author of the article.
item.dc:creator: Alf

item.title: Killing soldiers in war is now a crime
item.description:
BBC wrote:
Eight Iraqis have been arrested over the deaths of six Royal Military Police officers in 2003, the BBC has learned.

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/8513049.stm

item.title: General Synod says religion and science not mutually exclusive
item.description:
General Synod says religion and science not mutually exclusive?

Discuss.
item.dc:creator: blackrainbow

item.title: Critiques of "democracy"
item.description: Maybe I'm just thick or a democracy fetishist but I don't really get the point of them. Firstly, going on about how you're opposed to "democracy" will make you sound like some kind of totalitarian vanguardist to the uninitiated - but that's really an issue of how you present yourself to the outside world, not a problem with the critiques of democracy.

item.title: hunting for quote - German left communist? - on party
item.description:
Hiya, quick question. I seem to remember a quote, I think by Gorter or someone like that, which goes something like, "in the last analysis, every political party, every soviet, every union, is a party for or against the revolution". I can't find it using Google. Can anyone help?

Thanks.
item.dc:creator: posi

item.title: The economy.
item.description: One thing I've wondered is how the economy would run under a worker-managed society. If, based on the council models, socially owned enterprises exist at a local level, does this mean businesses won't be able to set up branches in other parts of the country, much less at an international scale? How would trade between other businesses and countries be conducted?
item.dc:creator: appledoze

item.title: How would we deal with/ what would happen if something clearly wrong was democratically voted for?
item.description: Just wondering how in an anarchist communist society we would deal with say a workers/community council that democratically voted to do something clearly wrong, like say something racist, sexist etc
item.dc:creator: D

item.title: My vision of a socialist society.
item.description: As some of you may have noticed one of my earlier threads involved me trying to find a schematic/chart of how the council system of early Soviet Russia worked.
item.dc:creator: appledoze

item.title: The Question of Parasitism Letter (edited) to Ingram of March 1996 recalling the ICC 1981 burglaries against oppositionists
item.description: ... The other day I was reflecting on one of the ICC raids of 1981. It was the second raid on my flat. From the top window, through the curtains, I saw three cars arrive and carefully park in front of the building. It was a dark, cold early evening. The lights in the flat had been turned off. Kl and I were in. Waiting. We knew they would return.
item.dc:creator: mciver

item.title: Would business exist?
item.description: Can business exist in an anrachist society?

item.title: Anarchism today?
item.description:
could you tell me/show me/explain to me how exactly anarchism would work in the contemporary uk?

I mean practically work and are there any anarchist communities in the world?

item.title: World Civil War

item.dc:creator: liam sionnach

item.title: An end to "positive" freedom?
item.description:
I take it anarchism doesn't agree with positive freedom, so after the glorious Revolution will their be an end to it, in favour of "negative" freedom.

I hate the term negative and positive and are obviously set up to give people negative connotations with negative freedom.

Positive freedom: Interferance in someones life for their own good/wellbeing e.g the smoking ban
item.dc:creator: The Outlaw
